items.question: How can I book a stay with Lau's Paws?
answer: The best way to get in touch is via the form on our
. Alternatively, you can make a booking via WhatsApp or with a Facebook message.

items.question: How far in advance do I need to book?
items.answer: Many clients book months in advance but if you can only book a few weeks in advance we'll always try to accommodate you if we have space. That said, you should book as far in advance as possible, especially for busier periods such as weekends, school holidays, and special dates like Christmas and New Year.

items.question: Can I schedule a meet-and-greet before booking?
items.answer: Once availability has been confirmed, it is our policy to always have a meet-and-greet before any new booking.

items.question: Does my dog need to have a trial stay?
items.answer: Yes, all new bookings must have a trial stay to make sure your dog is a good fit for Lau's Paws. We can then arrange a daytime or overnight trial stay on a date that's convenient for both parties. Standard rates apply and are non-refundable.

items.question: Do I have to pay a deposit to reserve a stay?
items.answer: Yes, you'll need to pay 25% of the cost of the total stay to secure your booking. This deposit is non-refundable.

items.question: How many dogs can stay at the same time?
items.answer: My licence allows me to have three boarders and my own dog, Lila, at the same time. This guarantees your dog lots more attention and comfort than commercial dog-boarding centres, but means they get the opportunity to play and socialise too.

items.question: Do you accept large breed dogs?
answer: No, we only accept small to medium-sized dogs. If you're unsure whether your breed qualifies as medium, please

items.question: Do you have age restrictions for dogs?
items.answer: Unfortunately I cannot accept puppies under one year of age. My dog Lila is very friendly and patient but she is now 10 and prefers to share her home with calmer canine companions.

items.question: Does my dog need to be house-trained?
items.answer: Yes, we only accept fully house-trained dogs. This ensures a clean and comfortable environment for all dogs staying with us.

items.question: What is the daily routine for the dogs in your care?
items.answer: Our days usually start with a toilet trip to the garden, followed by breakfast and a morning walk in one of the open spaces near my home. After lunch, the dogs are free to nap or play, then we go out in the afternoon for a second walk before dinner and finish the day with snuggles on the sofa before bed.

items.question: Where will my dog sleep?
items.answer: My dog Lila sleeps in bed with me and any dogs in my care are welcome to do the same. If you'd prefer, however, they can sleep anywhere in my home, such as on the sofa, curled up in a doggie bed in the living room, or even in the kitchen.

items.question: Do I need to provide my dog's food?
items.answer: Food is included in the price of boarding. That said, if you dog follows a particular diet and has their own special food then you would need to provide enough for the length of their stay when dropping them off.

items.question: Is your home secure and dog-proof?
items.answer: Yes, as a dog parent myself I have everything in place to make sure my home is safe and dog-proof. Security measures include a back garden with high fencing, locks on all my doors and windows, and gates at the top and bottom of my stairs.

items.question: Are you trained in dog first aid?
items.answer: Yes I am fully trained in dog first-aid and have the certification to prove it. Let me know if you would like to view a copy of this documentation and I'll be happy to provide it for you.

items.question: What happens if my dog becomes ill during their stay?
items.answer: I will inform you immediately if your dog becomes ill while in the care of Lau's Paws. Depending on the severity of the case we can then decide on the best course of action to ensure their comfort and safety.

items.question: Can you administer medicine to my dog?
items.answer: Yes, as a certified dog first-aider, I can administer basic medications, including oral and topical treatments, with clear instructions from you. However, for more complex medical needs, I recommend discussing these with me in advance to ensure I can safely accommodate your dog's requirements.

items.question: Do you require proof of vaccinations?
items.answer: Yes, all dogs must be fully vaccinated with proof of vaccinations before staying with Lau's Paws.

items.question: Does my dog need to be vaccinated against kennel cough?
items.answer: We prefer dogs to be vaccinated against kennel cough but it is not mandatory.

items.question: Do you offer discounts for longer stays or regular bookings?
answer: Stays for longer than a 24-hour period are charged at the reduced day rate rather than the usual overnight rate. If you would like to schedule a regular booking please
with more details to see if we can come to an agreement.

items.question: What is your cancellation policy?
items.answer: There is no charge for cancellations prior to 24 hours before the arranged stay, although we would have to keep the deposit. For cancellations less than 24 hours before, we require either the full payment or the price of an overnight stay, whichever is less.
